title: Jagannath Rath Yatra
description: Nine‑day chariot festival of Lord Jagannath–procession from Jagannath Temple to Gundicha Temple in Puri.

title: Guru Purnima
description: Day to honor and worship spiritual teachers–puja, satsang and gurus’ blessings.

title: Kamika Ekadashi
description: Ekadashi fast dedicated to Lord Vishnu; rituals, bhajans, and parana.

title: Sawan Shivratri
description: Monthly Shivratri: night‑long vigil, jalabhishek, chanting Shiva mantras.

title: Hariyali Teej
description: Festival celebrating greenery and marital harmony with mehendi, swings, fasts.

title: Nag Panchami
description: Worship of serpents—offering milk and prayers to snake idols or live snakes.

title: Raksha Bandhan
description: Sister ties sacred thread on brother’s wrist; blessings and gifts exchanged.

title: Krishna Janmashtami
description: Midnight abhishekam of Krishna idol, devotional songs and drama enactments.

title: Ganesh Chaturthi
description: Installation of Ganesha idols, daily aarti, culminating in visarjan on Anant Chaturdashi.

title: Pitru Paksha
description: 15‑day Shradh rituals—Tarpan, Pind Daan in memory of ancestors.

title: Durga Navratri
description: Nine‑day worship of Goddess Durga; fasting, nightly kirtans and vigils.

title: Dussehra
description: Victory of good over evil; Ram Lila, burning of Ravana effigies.

title: Diwali
description: Festival of Lights—Lakshmi Puja, fireworks, family feasts and gift‑giving.

title: Makar Sankranti
description: Harvest and sun festival—kite flying, bonfires, holy dip in rivers.

title: Vasant Panchami
description: Worship of Saraswati—yellow clothes, flowers, starting education and music.

title: Vaikuntha Ekadasi
description: One of the most important Ekadashi observances; “Vaikuntha Dwara Darshan” opens at Tirumala.

title: Ratha Saptami
description: Minor Brahmotsavam at Tirumala with Vahanam procession of Malayappa Swamy and consorts on multiple vahanas.

title: Srivari Teppotsavam (Float Festival)
description: Annual float festival in the temple tank – deities taken on decorated floats.

title: Srivari Brahmotsavam (Salakatla)
description: Nine-day grand celebration at Tirumala with Dwajarohanam, daily Vahanam processions including Garuda Seva and chariot festival.

title: Purattasi Shanivaralu (Saturdays)
description: Saturdays in the Tamil month of Purattasi—special prayers and offerings to Lord Venkateswara.
